snippet: The decision to allow some workers to retire early with full pension benefits has drawn rebukes from younger workers and from countries that Berlin had urged to adopt austerity measures.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's government reverses course and is loosening pension rules to allow some workers to retire early but still receive their full pension benefits; decision has touched off criticism within Germany from groups concerned about the costs, especially on future generations, and drawn accusations of hypocrisy from nations forced to swallow German-imposed austerity.

byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens, and Katarina Johannsen from Bamberg, Germany.

lead_paragraph: The decision to allow some workers to retire early with full pension benefits has drawn rebukes from younger workers and from countries that Berlin had urged to adopt austerity measures.

headline.main: After Tightening Pensions, Germany Eases Rules for Some
headline.print_headline: After Tightening Pensions, Germany Eases Rules for Some
